thread.title: EastEnders spoilers: Michelle loses the plot over Preston – recalling echoes of her own past with Dirty Den
thread.title_full: EastEnders spoilers: Michelle loses the plot over Preston – recalling echoes of her own past with Dirty Den

author: Claire Murphy
title: EastEnders spoilers: Michelle loses the plot over Preston – recalling echoes of her own past with Dirty Den
text:
Will Michelle's secret come out? (Photo: BBC) Share Get soaps updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Michelle is overwhelmed when her lover Preston announces that he and Bex are officially a couple. 
She’s bewildered that her little brother Martin is so supportive of the relationship, especially after Michelle did her best to persuade him the American wasn’t good enough for his daughter. 
Under pressure, Michelle cracks and her secrets coming tumbling out… Stacey tells Martin he should visit Michelle in hospital (Photo: BBC) 
Another age-gap romance is hotting up. Diane tells Kush she just wants to be platonic, then accepts an invitation to go for a drink in The Albert. But then he makes his feelings clear. He wants more than just friendship from her. What will Denise say in return? Kush & Denise enjoy a drink at The Albert (Photo: BBC) 
With the truth out in the open, Michelle faces the reaction of her family and friends. Her stress levels go through the roof and she loses control – it ends badly, and not just for her. Preston tells Michelle he's supporting Bex (Photo: BBC) 
Tina becomes emotional about the way Sylvie is acting and luckily Whitney is one again nearby to offer her support and comfort. But who is looking after her? 
The Square is still reeling from the revelations about Michelle Fowler’s inappropriate relationship. And of course, the girl has history. Die-hard fans from the 1980s will remember how scandalous it was when a 16-year-old schoolgirl (then played by Susan Tully, below), she got pregnant after an affair with her best friend Sharon’s dad Den Watts (Leslie Grantham), aged 39. Susan Tully in hospital with baby May in 1986 (Photo: BBC) 
Now nearly 50, she’s in trouble again – this time with a former pupil, Preston (Martin Anzor), who at 17 is over 30 years younger than her. Read More
